definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
shallow/light (color)
sound of moving water
to taste/to try/to experience/already/ever/once
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 淺嘗輒止的人是無法做學問的。

sentences.english: The theory of elegance seeking in poetry and ode was seldom paid adequate attention to in academic field.
sentences.chinese: 曹丕的“詩賦欲麗說”學界雖有關注，但都淺嘗輒止。

sentences.english: Don't be content to just skim over courses with "only to pass".
sentences.chinese: 不要只滿足於對功課淺嘗輒止，“只求及格”。

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed.
sentences.chinese: 有些書只需淺嘗輒止，有些書該囫圇吞食。

sentences.english: Of course, we have only just touched on some of its possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我們僅是淺嘗輒止而已。

definition: compassion/empathetic
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
magnanimous
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
conclusion/judgment/verdict
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
